result.execSummary:
The defendant David A. Belille Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence withheld; 3 years probation; conditions of probation 90 days county jail, work release with 4 days credit beginning 03-04-2015 at 3:00 p.m.  DNA sample; restitution to Recreational Rental Properties in the amount of $2500 (joint and several) Victim and probation officer can reduce restitution; fine/costs totaling $528.00.

miscConds.notes: $2,500 to be paid to Recreational Rental Properties. (joint and several) Victim and probation officer can reduce restitution.

$528.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: 90 days county jail, work release with 4 days credit beginning 03-04-2015 at 3:00 p.m.

Defendant David A. Belille in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Defendant David A. Belille in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant David A. Belille in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentence withheld; 3 years probation; conditions of probation 90 days county jail, work release with 4 days credit beginning 03-04-2015 at 3:00 p.m.  DNA sample; restitution to Recreational Rental Properties in the amount of $2500 (joint and several); fine/costs totaling $528.00.
